text: Samia Said Chowdhory (known as Samia Said or Samia Sayeed) is a Bangladeshi model and actress. She was the winner of Lux Channel I Superstar, the most prestigious beauty pageant in Bangladesh, was held in 2012. She started her acting career with the television drama Increment in 2012. Said rose to prominence with her film debut in the 2018 Beglali drama Komola Rocket directed by Noor Imran Mithu, which is a adaptation of two short stories Moulik and Saipras by Bengali writer Shahaduz Zaman. ==Early life and career== Samia Said was born in South Shields, England. She completed O Level from St Francis Xavier's Green Herald International School, and then A Level from Oxford International School in Dhaka. She studied English at North South University. The first ever music video Samia appeared in was called Anmona by Imran and Naumi. In 2016, Said appeared in the music video for Khan Asifur Rahman Agun' single "Ekbaro Ki Bhebechho" from the album Tin Tara. In 2018, she was selected to audition for the female lead in Noor Imran Mithu's film Komola Rocket by its director. Said won the role of a young lady Dishi, the interest of the main character Atik, played by Tauquir Ahmed. ==Personal life== Said married to Abu Safat Chowdhury on 18 April 2018. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="text- align:center;" ! scope="col"|Year ! scope="col"|Film ! scope="col"|Role ! class="unsortable" scope="col"|Notes |- | 2018 |Komola Rocket | Dishi, young lady | Debut |- |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="text-align:center;" ! scope="col"|Year ! scope="col"|Title ! scope="col"|Role ! class="unsortable" scope="col"|Notes |- | 2012 |Increment | | |- | |Dhanyee Meye | | |- | |Trade Fair | | |- | |Hoyto Tomari Jonno | | |- | 2012 |Palatak Shomoy | | |- | 2014 |Ke Bhashabe Shada Megher Bhela | | |- | 2016 |Bakshobondi | | |- |} ===Music video appearances=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align: left;" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Song !scope="col"| Performer(s) !scope="col"| Album |- ! !Anmona !Imran and Naumi ! |- | 2016 ! scope="row" | "Ekbaro Ki Bhebechho" | Khan Asifur Rahman Agun | Tin Tara |} ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Living people Category:21st-century Bangladeshi actresses Category:Bangladeshi female models Category:Bangladeshi television actresses Category:Bangladeshi film actresses Category:Bengali television actresses Category:Bangladeshi actresses Category:Reality television participants Category:North South University alumni Category:People from Comilla District Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Samia Said
